advanced/code-integration.title: Code Integration
advanced/code-integration.description: Link requirements to code, Git commits, and implementation artifacts.

advanced/legacy-import.title: Legacy Import
advanced/legacy-import.description: Import existing requirements from other tools or documents into ReqDrivenDev.

advanced/troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting
advanced/troubleshooting.description: Common issues and solutions when using ReqDrivenDev.

getting-started/introduction.title: Introduction
getting-started/introduction.description: Welcome to ReqDrivenDev, a Requirements-Driven Development tool designed to help engineers manage complex system requirements efficiently and safely.

getting-started/quick-start.title: Quick Start
getting-started/quick-start.description: Get started with ReqDrivenDev in 5 minutes. This tutorial walks you through creating your first Job, Scenario, and Requirement.

getting-started/ui-tour.title: UI Tour
getting-started/ui-tour.description: ReqDrivenDev uses a split-screen layout that separates the creative process from the committed truth.

guides/constraint-management.title: Constraint Management
guides/constraint-management.description: Constraints are rules that limit requirement values. They can be Safety, Physical, or Logical constraints, and they apply in specific scenarios.

guides/creating-requirements.title: Creating Requirements: The Drafting Loop
guides/creating-requirements.description: The Drafting Loop is the core workflow for creating requirements in ReqDrivenDev. It transforms natural language input into structured, validated requirements.

guides/defining-context.title: Defining Context: Jobs and Scenarios
guides/defining-context.description: Context is critical in requirements engineering. ReqDrivenDev uses Jobs and Scenarios to provide this context.

guides/error-guide.title: Error Guide: Understanding Validation Errors
guides/error-guide.description: When the system blocks a requirement, it provides a clear error message explaining why. This guide explains all error messages and how to resolve them.

intro.title: Tutorial Intro
intro.description: Let's discover Docusaurus in less than 5 minutes.

README.title: ReqDrivenDev Documentation
README.description: Welcome to the ReqDrivenDev user documentation. This site provides guides, references, and examples for using the Requirements-Driven Development tool.

reference/edge-types.title: Reference: Edge Types
reference/edge-types.description: This reference describes all edge types (relationships) available in ReqDrivenDev. Edges define how nodes connect in the knowledge graph.

reference/node-types.title: Reference: Node Types
reference/node-types.description: This reference describes all node types available in ReqDrivenDev. Each node type serves a specific purpose in the requirements graph.

reference/search-guide.title: Search Guide
reference/search-guide.description: ReqDrivenDev provides semantic search to help you find related requirements and prevent duplicates.

scenarios/drafting-first-req.title: Scenario: Drafting Your First Requirement
scenarios/drafting-first-req.description: A real-world walkthrough of creating your first requirement in ReqDrivenDev.

scenarios/handling-conflicts.title: Scenario: Handling Constraint Conflicts
scenarios/handling-conflicts.description: A real-world example of what happens when a requirement conflicts with an existing constraint.

tutorial-basics/congratulations.title: Congratulations!
tutorial-basics/congratulations.description: You have just learned the basics of Docusaurus and made some changes to the initial template.

tutorial-basics/create-a-blog-post.title: Create a Blog Post
tutorial-basics/create-a-blog-post.description: Docusaurus creates a page for each blog post, but also a blog index page, a tag system, an RSS feed...

tutorial-basics/create-a-document.title: Create a Document
tutorial-basics/create-a-document.description: Documents are groups of pages connected through:

tutorial-basics/create-a-page.title: Create a Page
tutorial-basics/create-a-page.description: Add Markdown or React files to src/pages to create a standalone page:

tutorial-basics/deploy-your-site.title: Deploy your site
tutorial-basics/deploy-your-site.description: Docusaurus is a static-site-generator (also called Jamstack).

tutorial-basics/markdown-features.title: Markdown Features
tutorial-basics/markdown-features.description: Docusaurus supports Markdown and a few additional features.

tutorial-extras/manage-docs-versions.title: Manage Docs Versions
tutorial-extras/manage-docs-versions.description: Docusaurus can manage multiple versions of your docs.
